body.p: This document provides a comparison of the DITA features in the default FrameMaker 8, 9, 10, 11, and 12, with those in DITA-FMx 1.1 and 2.0.

row.entry: Support for key-based glossary term references
Edit referenced topics and maps by clicking topicref
Open all referenced files in map
Update all topicref labels in map
Topicref label options (title, file name, or both)
Search for content in referenced files
Generate a FM book (for search and spell check) that contains all referenced XML files
Generate a report of all referenced files
Generate a ZIP archive of files referenced by map
Visual labeling of linking and collection-type attribute values
Auto-open DITA map in document view
Create new topic or map based on type
Automatically generate file name based on title text and building blocks
Specify custom template for new topic or map
Insert prolog data on file creation
Create a DITA map and topic files from FrameMaker file
Ability to overwrite an existing file on file creation
Ability to create new topic folders based on topic type on file creation
Switch between DITA 1.2 and DITA 1.1 without restarting FrameMaker
Automatically assign IDs to required elements
Automatically add author and date to draft-comments
Context sensitive Help for element structure
Limit the number of files opened when resolving references (results in faster reference resolving)
Provide support for multiple selection of filtering attribute values
Dynamic “link” (in related-links section) creation and management
Strip XML padding from pretty-printed files
Properly round-trips column widths in simpletable and choicetable elements
Automatically, insert/update prolog data on file save
Determine where an element or topic is referenced (Where Used command)
Support index-see, index-see-also, and index-sort-as elements
Provide custom management of index-see, index-see-also, and index-sort-as labels in index entries
Support indexterms as markers and as a container (to allow for complex element nesting)
Whitespace normalization for easier transfer between XML editors
Support optional columns in properties tables
Display only the available element types when inserting a conref or xref
Support topic-based DTDs rather than “ditabase” if needed
Supports inline tagging anywhere within codeblock
Automatically set the @status for new and changed elements
Support separate sizing of images when rendered in FM vs. the DITA-OT
Generate output from the DITA Open Toolkit
Specify ditaval file for DITA-OT output
Generate a single FM document from all topics in the map
Map to book (aggregates all topics into FM chapters for PDF output)

entry.p: Creates separate FM files for each topic

row.entry: Map to book output can be generated at any location in the file system

entry.p: FM files are created in topic folders

row.entry: Support “per-project” control of generated book formatting and properties.

entry.p: All output uses the same INI file settings
All output uses the same INI file settings

row.entry: Apply filtering to generated book based on ditaval file
Attribute values on topic referencing elements in map are passed on to topics in the generated FM files
Option to move indexterms in prolog to topic title
Automatically apply numbering and pagination to generated FM files
Automatically generate FM lists (toc, index, etc.) from “booklist” files
Automatically include FM binary files in generated book
Option to move figure titles so they follow the image
Use “real” FM table titles (for tables that wrap pages and include the Table Continuation variable)
Support table row and cell shading
Support table indenting based on parent element
Automatically apply a custom template to each bookmap component
Automatically run a custom FDK client or FrameScript during the book-build process
Run pre and post book-build command line scripts
Import attributes and metadata from map as variables and conditions
